channel.title: ::Command
channel.description:
Before anything, I'd like to say this: Yes, I'm not the best of coders, and yes, I usually do try, so before posting, think about what your going to say, if it's relevant, thank you, if not, please take your attitude elsewhere. Thanks.
Ok, I got a new server and basically don't have a command menu when I type ::commands. Could someone maybe lead me or maybe paste the code for the code please. Thanks.

item.title: ::Command

‘Eh Pretty Easy’, Can I add you on messenger?

item.title: ::Command
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

public void CommandsHelp() { sendQuest("@dre@Server Commands", 8144); //Title clearQuestInterface(); sendQuest("@dbl@commands here...", 8145); sendQuest("@dbl@commands here...", 8147); sendQuest("@dbl@Players Online: @gre@"+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount(), 8148); sendQuest("@dbl@commands here...", 8149); sendQuest("@dbl@@red@commands here...", 8150); sendQuest("@dbl@more", 8152); sendQuest("@dbl@@red@more...", 8153); sendQuest("@dbl@@red@", 8154); sendQuest("@dbl@more...", 8155); sendQuest("@dbl@@red@more...", 8156); sendQuestSomething(8143); showInterface(8134); flushOutStream(); }Add that void, and add this command if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("commands")) { CommandsHelp(); }This should work, but not 100% sure. Put your commands to the spots where I put more… and commands here…

Read full topic
